name: Gmail modules
title: Gmail modules

children.text: After connecting to the Gmail app, you can use the following modules to build your

to filter emails by selecting criteria, or
to filter emails by entering the query.
Select the email folder where you want to search.
Select the label to search by.
Select the criteria of the emails you want to search:
Set the maximum number of results that
will work with during one cycle. Must be lower than or equal to 500.
Enter the email address(es) to search for emails from specific senders.
Enter a word or phrase to search for in the subject line of emails.
Enter the words to search for emails that contain them.
Enter the words to search for emails that don't contain them.
Enter the email size to search for emails of a specific size. You can specify the criteria, size, and size units.
Enter the date for the email search range.
Select whether to search for emails that have attachments.
Select the level of detail returned from the email message:
Select whether to include the raw HTML body alongside the full text body.
Create a connection to your Gmail account.
Enter the ID of the email message you want to retrieve. You can use the
to search for and select the correct ID.
Select the level of detail to return from the email message:
Copies an email or a draft into a selected folder.
Create a connection to your Gmail account
Enter the ID of the email or draft that you want to copy. You can use the
to search for and select the correct ID.
Select the folder where the email will be copied.
Moves the chosen email or a draft to the selected folder.
Create a connection to your Gmail account
Enter the ID of the email or draft you want to move.
to search for and select the correct ID.
Updates labels on the specified email message.
Create a connection to your Gmail account
Enter the ID of the email message you want to update. You can use the
to search for and select the correct ID.
Marks an email or a draft as read by setting the "Read" flag.
Create a connection to your Gmail account
Enter the ID of the email message or draft that you want to mark as read. You can use the
to search for and select the correct ID.
Marks an email or a draft as unread by setting the "Unread" flag.
Create a connection to your Gmail account
Enter the ID of the email message or draft that you want to mark as unread. You can use the
to search for and select the correct ID.
Deletes an email by moving it to trash.
Create a connection to your Gmail account
Enter the ID of the email message that you want to delete. You can use the
to search for and select the correct ID.
Create a connection to your Gmail account
Enter a custom sender email address.
There are two options for entering:
a custom name in quotes before a custom sender email address:
an email address that you're already connected with:
If not provided, the email will be sent from the default account set in your Gmail settings.
Add custom headers to the email.
Enter the email message body. You can use HTML tags.
Add custom content to include as your email signature. You can use HTML tags.

to search for and select the correct ID.

to search for and select the correct ID.

to search for and select the correct ID.

media or attachment file data should be included in the output bundle

to retrieve information for an entry.
to make a partial entry update.
Enter the desired request headers. You don't have to add authorization headers; we added those for you.
Enter the body content for your API call.

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.

children.name: Create and configure a Google Cloud Platform project for Gmail
